question: What is React?
options: A programming language
A JavaScript framework for building user interfaces
A database management system
An operating system
correctAnswer: A JavaScript framework for building user interfaces

question: In React, which method is used to update the component when its state or props change??
options: `render()`
`componentWillUpdate()`
`shouldComponentUpdate()`
`ComponentDidUpdate()`

question: What does JSX stand for in React?
options: JavaScript XML
Java Standard Extension
JSON XHR
JavaScript XHR

question: In React, what is the purpose of the virtual ?
options: To display HTML content
To manage database operations
To provide a simulation of the real DOM for performance optimization
To handle network requests
correctAnswer: To provide a simulation of the real DOM for performance optimization

question: In React, what is a prop?
options: A local state variable
A method of rendering components
A way to pass data from parent to child components
A build-in React Components
correctAnswer: A way to pass data from parent to child components

question: What does React Router do in a React application?
options: It manage the internal of components
It provides a way to create animations in React
It helps in routing and navigating between different views in a single-page application
It handles authentication and authorization processes
correctAnswer: It helps in routing and navigating between different views in a single-page application

question: What is the role of the Redux library in a React application?
options: It helps in routing and navigation
It provides a way to manage global state and state changes
It handles the styling and layout of components
It enables server-side rendering in React applications
correctAnswer: It provides a way to manage global state and state changes

question: What is the significance of the React.Fragment element?
options: It is used to create functional components in React
It provides a way to group multiple elements without adding an additional DOM node
It is a part of the React Router library
It defines the root element of a React application
correctAnswer: It provides a way to group multiple elements without adding an additional DOM node

question: What are React refs used for?
options: To define the rendering order of components
To access the DOM nodes directly to React component
To define the structure of the virtual DOM
To manage component props and state
correctAnswer: To access the DOM nodes directly in React components

question: In React, what is the purpose of the children prop?
options: It defines the color scheme of child components
It specifies the font size of child components
It provides a way to pass elements or components as children to another component
It manages the state of child components
correctAnswer: It provides a way to pass elements or components as children to another component
